SEARCH
Package com.example.dangle_lotto

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.dangle_lotto.Event
public class Event extends Object
Represents an Event within the Dangle Lotto system.

Each event tracks participants across four distinct states: Registered, Chosen, SignUps, and Cancelled. The class handles all participant transitions between these states and maintains synchronization with Firebase through FirebaseManager.

State Flow:

 Registered → Chosen → (SignUps OR Cancelled)
Since:
2025-11-01

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event(String eid, String organizer_id, String name, com.google.firebase.Timestamp deadline, String location, String description, String photo_id, int eventSize, ArrayList<String> categories, FirebaseManager firebaseManager)
      Constructs an Event object and initializes participant lists by asynchronously fetching data from Firebase.
      Parameters:
      eid - Unique event identifier.
      organizer_id - Organizer’s user ID.
      name - Event name.
      deadline - Event deadline or draw date.
      location - Location where event occurs.
      description - Description of the event.
      photo_id - Associated photo identifier.
      eventSize - Maximum number of attendees.
      categories - List of category tags.
      firebaseManager - Reference to FirebaseManager instance.

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> addRegistered(String uid)
      Adds a user to the registered list and removes them from other lists.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      A Firebase Task representing the asynchronous operation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the user is already registered.

    • chooseLottoWinners

      public void chooseLottoWinners()
      Randomly selects event participants from the registered list.

      Users are moved from Registered → Chosen. If fewer users are registered than the event’s capacity, all are chosen. Otherwise, a random subset is selected up to the event size.

      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if there are no registered users.
